problem: The graph of $y = f(x)$ passes through the point $(-4,-7).$  If $f(x)$ is an even function, then what other point must the graph pass through?  Enter your answer as an ordered pair.
solution:
Since $f(x)$ is an even function, $f(-x) = f(x).$  In particular,
\[f(4) = f(-4) = -7.\]Therefore, the graph of $f(x)$ must also pass through the point $\boxed{(4,-7)}.$
